page.title: 13PLANTS IN DISTRICT OF MARSKE
page.content: Heather & ling on moorland giving way to Blae berries, Agrostis & Bracken where heavier grazing. Woods undergrown with Dog's Mercury, Celandine,Garlic, Snowdrops & Bluebell. Valleys have a profusion of small plants e.g. Thyme, Campion, Buttercup, Violet, Lady's Smock, Cowslip, Harebell, Primrose, Speedwell, Shepherds purse, Deadnettles, Cleavers,Plantain, Sorrel, Bird'sfoot trefoil & Tormentil. Mallow, Meadow cranesbill, Silverweed, Water avens, Dandelion & Stitchwort line the rodside verges but in places are now being overgrown with Nettles, Umbelliferae, Rosebay Willowherb & Docks due to soil disturbance of road works. By the water's edge Marsh Marigold, Heartsease & Gorse can be found.
